definition: to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess
to monopolize/to seize/to take into one's arms/to embrace/to fasten (with a rope etc)/to take on (responsibility etc)/to canvass
to enlist the services of sb

sentences.english: We advertised our services to make more bussiness.
sentences.chinese: 我们登广告宣传自己的服务项目来招揽生意。

sentences.english: Zhou gong was very diligent at government matters when assisting young King Cheng. He tried to attract talents widely.
sentences.chinese: 周公辅佐年幼的成王时，勤于政事，广泛招揽人才。

sentences.english: The department sore is offering big discounts to drum up business.
sentences.chinese: 为了招揽生意这家百货商场进行打折活动。

sentences.english: Ochroma manages to attract its clientele through a simple trick of timing.
sentences.chinese: 巴尔沙树通过一种简单的时机选择将顾客们招揽来。

sentences.english: Securities companies shall not procure the underwriting business with improper means of competition.
sentences.chinese: 证券公司不得以不正当竞争手段招揽证券承销业务。

sentences.english: It’s raised paw is said to beckon customers and money into shops.
sentences.chinese: 它那举着的小爪子意来为店家招揽客人和钱财。

sentences.english: He was soon drafted into the NBA as a guard for the Chicago Bulls.
sentences.chinese: 不久，他受NBA招揽，成为芝加哥公牛队的后卫。

sentences.english: Plaintiff thereafter began to recruit advertisement clients.
sentences.chinese: 此后，原告方开始对外招揽广告客户。

sentences.english: Many taxis were cruising in the downtown area.
sentences.chinese: 很多出租汽车在市区内缓缓行驶以招揽生意。

sentences.english: The barber was tinkling the metal to canvass for business.
sentences.chinese: 理发师在胡同中敲着唤头招揽生意。

sentences.english: Manufacturers are offering big discounts to drum up business.
sentences.chinese: 生产厂家正提供很大的折扣来招揽生意。

sentences.english: From content business exterior the work that solicits core management layer still did not stop.
sentences.chinese: 从内容商外部招揽核心管理层的工作仍未停止。

sentences.english: The very process of shooting for these people will make your pitch better.
sentences.chinese: 这种招揽人才的手段可以使你的公司形象变得更好。

sentences.english: Journalists may not solicit advertisements in the name of news coverage.
sentences.chinese: 新闻记者不得借采访名义招揽广告。

sentences.english: Talley Moore tries to drum up business in Lookout Mountain, Tenn.
sentences.chinese: 卢克奥特山市场的一名摊主在招揽顾客。

definition: to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
to recruit soldiers and buy horses (idiom); to raise a large army/fig. to expand business/to recruit new staff
to lobby/to campaign/to promote (an idea, a product)/(old) to visit various rulers and promote one's political ideas (in the Warring States period)
to rely on help from sb
to win the support of/to get over to one's side/to keep control of
to recommend sb/to give a referral
to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote
